results.title: Antihyperalgesia effect of AMP-activated protein kinase (AMPK) activators in a mouse model of postoperative pain.
results.text_hl: CONCLUSIONS: Early treatment with the mechanism-specific AMPK activator O304 or the prototype AMPK activator @<m>CHEMICAL_Metformin</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D008687 @@@metformin@@@ reduces @DISEASE_Drug_Hypersensitivity @DISEASE_MESH:D004342 @@@mechanical hypersensitivity@@@ in a @<m>DISEASE_Pain_Postoperative</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D010149 @@@postoperative pain@@@ model in @SPECIES_10090 @@@mice@@@.

citations.NLM: Das V, Kroin JS, Moric M, McCarthy RJ, Buvanendran A. Antihyperalgesia effect of AMP-activated protein kinase (AMPK) activators in a mouse model of postoperative pain. Reg Anesth Pain Med. 2019 Jun 21;():. PMID: 31229963
citations.BibTeX: @article{31229963, title={Antihyperalgesia effect of AMP-activated protein kinase (AMPK) activators in a mouse model of postoperative pain.}, author={Das V and Kroin JS and Moric M and McCarthy RJ and Buvanendran A}, journal={Reg Anesth Pain Med}}

results.title: [Metformin-new potential medicine in pain treatment?]
results.text_hl: The activation of @GENE_PRKAB1 @GENE_5564 @@@AMPK@@@ with @<m>CHEMICAL_Metformin</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D008687 @@@metformin@@@ has led to decreased @DISEASE_Pain @DISEASE_MESH:D010146 @@@pain@@@ in @DISEASE_Neuralgia @DISEASE_MESH:D009437 @@@neuropathic@@@ and @<m>DISEASE_Pain_Postoperative</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D010149 @@@postsurgical pain@@@ models, suggesting that these drugs and this mechanism of actin might be effective in @SPECIES_9606 @@@humans@@@.

citations.NLM: Kiałka M, Doroszewska K, Janeczko M, Milewicz T. [Metformin-new potential medicine in pain treatment?] Przegl Lek. 2017;74(2):81-3. PMID: 29694764
citations.BibTeX: @article{29694764, title={[Metformin-new potential medicine in pain treatment?]}, author={Kiałka M and Doroszewska K and Janeczko M and Milewicz T}, journal={Przegl Lek}, volume={74}, number={2}, pages={81-3}}
